critique: This executive order establishes a National Commission on Space. It doesn't directly address ideological issues, immigration, or civil liberties. It focuses on space exploration and policy. The order itself doesn't expand executive power significantly, as it mainly creates a commission to study and make recommendations. It has a slight centralizing effect as it directs federal agencies to support the commission, but it's not a major shift in federalism. There's no direct economic regulation or social inclusion aspect to this order.
